title: D.C. Panel Recommends Disbarment for Trump Official Jeffrey Clark
description: A Washington, D.C., attorney disciplinary panel has recommended disbarment for Jeffrey Clark, a former senior Justice Department official under President Donald Trump, for his efforts to overturn the 2020 presidential election. The panel found that Clark was willing to have the Justice Department falsely claim it had found significant issues with the election results, particularly in Georgia, where he proposed sending a misleading letter to state officials urging them to consider overturning the results. The majority on the nine-member D.C. Board on Professional Responsibility ruled that Clark violated fundamental legal ethics by advocating based on falsehoods. The final decision rests with the D.C. Court of Appeals. While White House Office of Management and Budget spokesperson Rachel Cauley defended Clark as a victim of political targeting, others pointed to serious breaches of legal conduct. A previous panel recommended a two-year suspension, and two board members advocated a three-year suspension instead of disbarment. Clark has denied any wrongdoing.

title: Elon Musk to scale back involvement with Trumpâ€™s DOGE as Tesla profits take massive hit
description: Elon Musk announced plans to significantly reduce his involvement with the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) starting in May to refocus on Tesla, following a 71% drop in quarterly profits. DOGE, established to audit agencies and cut federal spending, has faced criticism for its impact on government operations and Musk\'s divided attention.

title: DOJ Shifts Focus to Voter Fraud Investigations
description: The DOJ\'s Civil Rights Division has redirected its efforts from traditional voting rights enforcement to investigating voter fraud and promoting \'honest elections,\' aligning with former President Trump\'s claims of widespread voter fraud in the 2020 election.

title: FBI Disbands Public Corruption Squad in Washington Office
description: The FBI has disbanded a squad in its Washington field office dedicated to investigating fraud and public corruption involving members of Congress and federal officials, reflecting a broader reorganization under the Trump administration.

title: DOJ Introduces New Whistleblower Policy Targeting Immigration Violations
description: The DOJ has implemented a new whistleblower policy prioritizing tips about employers violating federal immigration laws, signaling an aggressive crackdown on employers of immigrants and H-1B visa holders.

title: FBI Agents Sue Over DOJ Directive on January 6 Investigations
description: The FBI Agents Association and anonymous employees have filed a lawsuit against the DOJ over a directive to identify all personnel involved in January 6 investigations, citing concerns over potential retaliation and safety risks.

title: Supreme Court Overturns Injunction on HHS Reorganization
description: The Supreme Court overturned a lower court\'s injunction, allowing the Department of Health and Human Services to proceed with its reorganization and Reduction in Force (RIF) affecting approximately 20,000 employees, primarily in early childhood programs.

title: Supreme Court Declines to Hear Election Law Case
description: The Supreme Court declined to hear a case challenging a state\'s election law, leaving the lower court\'s ruling intact.

title: Appeals Court Rules on Voting Rights Act Challenge
description: A federal appeals court upheld a lower court\'s decision that a state\'s voting laws violated the Voting Rights Act.

title: District Court Blocks New Immigration Policy
description: A federal district court issued a temporary injunction against a new immigration policy, citing constitutional concerns.

title: Court Allows Trump to End Union Bargaining for Federal Workers
description: A federal appeals court lifted an injunction, allowing the Trump administration to proceed with an executive order ending collective bargaining rights for federal workers.

title: Judge Sides with Trump in Fight Over Fired Copyright Office Head
description: A federal judge declined to reinstate Shira Perlmutter, former head of the U.S. Copyright Office, after her dismissal by the Trump administration.

title: SEC Charges Carl Icahn for Failing to Disclose Pledging of Company Shares
description: The SEC charged Carl Icahn and Icahn Enterprises L.P. for failing to disclose the pledging of company securities as collateral for personal margin loans, as required by Item 403(b) of Regulation S-K.

title: Treasury Department Suspends Enforcement of Corporate Transparency Act for U.S. Entities
description: The Treasury Department announced it will not enforce penalties associated with the beneficial ownership information reporting rule under the Corporate Transparency Act for U.S. entities, pending proposed rule changes.
